reviewTexts: I've spent over 300 hours building my factory and I still haven't launched a rocket. The factory must grow. Send help... actually no, don't. I need to optimize my green circuit production first.
Started playing at 8 PM, looked at the clock and it's 6 AM. My factory needs me. My family doesn't understand. The conveyor belts call to me.
This game is basically Excel with graphics. I have spreadsheets for my spreadsheets. 10/10 would automate again.

reviewText: My crops are watered, my chickens are fed, and I've given my wife her favorite gift. Why can't real life be this simple? Also, I married a purple-haired girl who eats gems. 10/10 would farm again.
I came for the card game, stayed for the existential crisis about whether the innkeeper is real. Also, there's a really good card game. Did I mention the card game?
Finally, a game where I can be a goat and ruin everyone's day. Jumped on cars, headbutted people, got stuck in a fence. 11/10 for physics.
Died to the first boss 47 times. Finally beat it. Felt like a god. Died to a regular enemy 2 minutes later. This game hates me and I love it.
I built a house, it exploded. I built another house, a green thing blew it up. I built a third house underground, and I'm never coming out. At least I have diamonds now.
Started a new playthrough as a stealth archer. Swore I'd be a mage this time. Somehow I'm a stealth archer again. How does this keep happening?
I tried to be good. I really did. But that chicken looked at me funny and now the entire town wants me dead. 10/10 emergent gameplay.
Instructions unclear. Accidentally started a nuclear war with Gandhi. He's surprisingly aggressive for a pacifist. Just one more turn before bed... *sunrise happens*
I've never felt more stressed organizing rectangles in my entire life. But when you get that perfect clear, *chef's kiss*. The music slaps too.
My space program's motto: 'Moar Boosters!' I've sent more brave Kerbals to their doom than I'd like to admit. But hey, we made it to the Mun eventually!
This cake better be worth it. I've been insulted by a robot for 6 hours straight and I'm starting to develop feelings for my companion cube. The cake was a lie.
WAR. WAR NEVER CHANGES. But my settlements always need my help. Preston, please, I'm trying to explore here. No, I don't want to help another settlement.
I punch tree. I get wood. I make pickaxe. I mine stone. 300 hours later I have a castle and I still haven't beaten the game. 10/10 would punch tree again.
Psychology horror about depression, anxiety, and... wait, this is supposed to be a cute dating sim? *PTSD intensifies* Just Monika. Just Monika. JUST MONIKA.
